attributes.title: Stock verification
attributes.description:
Findings;

·       A stock take exercise was conducted on 12.05.25 to assess the effectiveness of internal controls that are put in place to safeguard company assets.

·       The following were the stock findings;

Ø  Bread variance- (-402 loaves)

Ø  White flour-     ( -1bag 25kg)

Ø  Yeast-       ( -26 sachets 125g each)

Ø  White Ingredients-   (-7 bags)

Ø  Bread roll premix-     (-2 bags)

Ø  Polybags-    (-4,962 pieces)

Summary of the findings
attributes.recommendation: Stock shortfall should be recovered from the responsible individuals and proper controls initiated to prevent such cases in future.
attributes.effect: Significant variances are noted in the stock items indicating that the stock controls are not effective.

value: Stock variances will be recovered and I promise to improve my work.

Stock variances have been fully recovered from the manager and foremen.

We will initiate corrective actions to curb such issues.
In the previous audit findings; Bread shortfall was 64.5 loaves, sweet bread premix +1 bag and polybags had a variance of +139 pcs.

attributes.title: Bread weight check
attributes.description:
Findings;

·        Sample varieties of packed bread were randomly picked and weighed to establish whether the branch adheres to weights and measures standards.

·        Most of the sample varieties conform to the standard weight.

·        The underweight samples were spread as follows; 200g W- 05%, 400g W- 08% and 800g W- 02%.

The table below summarizes the findings
attributes.recommendation: Weight controls should be maintained.
attributes.effect: ·        Most of the sample bread conform to the standard weight indicating that production standards are being observed.

value: We will maintain.
The positive trend will be maintained.
Minimal cases of underweight were noted in the previous audit spot check.

attributes.title: Damages analysis
attributes.description:
·     Findings;

·        Analysis of bread damages from 10.04.25 – 11.05.25 was done to verify if the level of bread damages was maintained within the set limits of 0.25% of the total production and 0.2% of the total sales.

·        A total of 872 loaves were damaged under production damages which represent 0.19% of the total loaves produced.

·        927.75 loaves were damaged under market damages (market returns and expired bread) representing 0.25% of the total sales over the audited period.

·        Market damages exceeded the set limit by 174 loaves worth Ksh. 9,309.

Below is a summary table of the findings
attributes.recommendation: ·        Branch management to ensure that damages are maintained within the set limits.
attributes.effect: Excess bread damages worth Ksh. 9,309 is an indication that the company is exposed to losses due to excess bread damages.

value: This will be further improved.
We improved from the previous findings and we will put more effort.
In the previous audit findings, both production and market damages exceeded the set limits by a total of 1,183 loaves worth Ksh. 63,291.

attributes.title: Cash verification
attributes.description:
Findings;

·        Cash count was done on 12 May 2025 to verify if the branch petty cash balance was correct and proper records were maintained.

·        No material variance was noted on the spot-check day.
attributes.recommendation: The branch should ensure that patty cash records and balances are well maintained
attributes.effect: No material variance was noted between physical cash and book balance indicating that   effective controls are in place.

value: To be maintained.
To be maintained.
No variances were reported in the cash office in the previous audit findings.

attributes.title: Production Efficiency
attributes.description:
Findings;

·        Production and packaging efficiency were analyzed from 10.04.25 – 11.05.25 to find out if the branch achieved the set production efficiency of 5 bags per worker.

·        The branch hired a total of 409 production workers over the audited period hence the expected production was 2,045 bags.

·        The actual production was 2,044 bags leading to an actual efficiency of 5.0 bags per worker.

·        The set efficiency was achieved

Production efficiency
attributes.recommendation: ·        Management to maintain the proper planning of production workers in order to consistently achieve the set efficiency.
attributes.effect: The set efficiency was achieved indicating that the planned labour cost was observed.

value: To be maintained
To be maintained
Production efficiency reported in the previous audit findings was 4.9 bags per worker.

attributes.title: Packaging Efficiency
attributes.description:
Findings;

·        Packaging efficiency was analyzed from 10.04.25 – 11.05.25 to find out if the branch achieved the set target of 97 crates per worker.

·        The total bread produced over the audited period is 29,377 crates hence the expected slicers to be hired was 303 workers.

·        A total of 305 workers were hired leading to a packaging efficiency of 89.6 crates per worker which is slightly below the target.

·        Extra 25 packers were hired over the audit period and the set packaging efficiency was not achieved.

Packaging efficiency
attributes.recommendation: Management to improve on the planning of slicing workers to ensure that the set efficiency is consistently achieved.
attributes.effect: The set packaging efficiency was not achieved indicating that the planned packaging cost was exceeded by Ksh. 22,800.

value: To be improved
To be improved
The packaging efficiency reported in the previous audit findings was 95.4 crates per person and 5 packers were recruited in excess.

attributes.title: Motor vehicle fuel consumption
attributes.description:
Findings;

·        Analysis of fuel consumption by the delivery vehicles was done for the month of April 2025 to verify if their consumption rate is within the set standards.

·        All the three vehicles showed significant variation in fuel usage as follows;

KCG 427W- Excess 77 Litres

KCM 422R- Excess 41 Litres

KBW 930K- Saved 97 litres
attributes.recommendation:
Findings;

·    Analysis of fuel consumption by the delivery vehicles was done for the month of April 2025 to verify if their consumption rate is within the set standards.

·    All the three vehicles showed significant variation in fuel usage as follows;

KCG 427W- Excess 77 Litres

KCM 422R- Excess 41 Litres

KBW 930K- Saved 97 litres
attributes.effect: Significant variation between the actual fuel usage and standard fuel provided provide a loophole for fuel misuse.

value:
•    The provided rates of fuel consumption should be revised to give accurate usage 
•    Leaking fuel tank should be repaired.

•    KCM 422R has a leaking fuel tank. It cannot be fuel to the brim hence calculating its efficiency becomes challenging.
•    KBW 930K and KCG 427W are showing variation and their fuel consumption rates should be reviewed.
No previous audit findings

attributes.title: Generator Fuel analysis
attributes.description:
Findings;

·        Analysis of fuel consumption by the generator was done for the month of April 2025 to verify if its consumption rate is within the set rate.

·        The generator run for 4.2 hours and used 23 litres of fuel. Its consumption rate was 5.5 L/hr.

·        Generator fuel usage is within the range

Generator fuel consumption
attributes.recommendation: Fuel controls should continue to be adhered
attributes.effect: Fuel consumption rates are within the range indicating that fuel controls are being observed.

value: To be maintained
To be maintained
Generator fuel consumption reported in the previous audit findings was 12.6 L/hr.
